title: Police Chiefs and Mayors - Virginia Beach

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please identify the last 12 police chiefs before December 31, 2021. Include their first and last name, start and end date (MM/DD/YYYY), type of separation (e.g., retired, resigned), internal/external hire, and if they were acting/interim.

Separately and in addition, please also identify the mayor who was in office during the police chief's start date. Include their first and last name, gender, race/ethnicity, and party identification (e.g., Republican, Democratic).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with John Navarro.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request an electronic copy of all FBI files on Marty Krofft, who produced the popular televisions shows “H.R. Pufnstuf” and “Land of the Lost” He died in November 2023. This is his obituary: https://variety.com/2023/film/news/marty-krofft-dead-h-r-pufnstuf-1235808822/

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please identify the last 13 police chiefs before December 31, 2021. Include their first and last name, start and end date (MM/DD/YYYY), type of separation (e.g., retired, resigned), internal/external hire, and if they were acting/interim.

Separately and in addition, please also identify the mayor who appointed the police chief. Include their first and last name, gender, race/ethnicity, and party identification (e.g., Republican, Democrat).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with John Navarro.
